doc.title: Letter: Italian protests
doc.author: Guardian Staff; Guardian staff reporter
doc.description: Letters: The Italian government is erasing the basic principles of democracy, ignoring all opposition and diminishing the importance of a whole country demonstrating against Berlusconi and his ministers

main.p:
The Italian government is erasing the basic principles of democracy, ignoring all opposition and diminishing the importance of a whole country demonstrating against Berlusconi and his ministers. Students are protesting, parents with their children, university researchers, professors and directors. We live in a state where a brave writer like Roberto Saviano can't walk around safely because our government allows the mafia to be stronger than it is (Letters, October 22). We live in a country where the government ignores its commitments to Europe for the environment. Well, everywhere south of Naples is probably a lot worse than the east European countries now. As the people who have a little conscience left are finally protesting, Berlusconi is planning to send the police to stop them; the only possible dialogue will be with their truncheons. Prepare for a new G8.Paola Palladinovia
Turin
